NumberInput.name: change
NumberInput.description: Fires whenever the NumberInput loses focus and its value was changed.

NumberInput.name: input
NumberInput.description: Fires whenever the NumberInput has its value changed.

NumberInput.name: radius
NumberInput.description: Changes the border radius of the NumberInput.

NumberInput.name: shape
NumberInput.description: Changes the shape of the NumberInput.

NumberInput.name: sizing
NumberInput.description: Renders the NumberInput at a different sizes.

NumberInput.name: variation
NumberInput.description: Alters the rendered appearance of the NumberInput.

NumberInput.name: disabled
NumberInput.description: Renders the NumberInput with disabled attribute, and styles the NumberInput partially transparent.

NumberInput.name: required
NumberInput.description: Sets if the NumberInput should be required, which will fail submission on a <form> if missing.

NumberInput.name: readonly
NumberInput.description: Sets if the NumberInput should be readonly, which will prevent further edits.

NumberInput.name: name
NumberInput.description: Sets the form name of the NumberInput.

NumberInput.name: placeholder
NumberInput.description: Sets the text that is rendered if there is no current value.

NumberInput.name: value
NumberInput.description: Sets the text value of the NumberInput.

NumberInput.name: max
NumberInput.description: Sets the maximum amount of characters that the end-user CAN input, which will fail submission on a <form> if the input is invalid.

NumberInput.name: min
NumberInput.description: Sets the minimum amount of characters that the end-user MUST input, which will fail submission on a <form> if the input is invalid.

NumberInput.name: span_x=
NumberInput.description: Sets the width of the NumberInput to an approximation of the amount of characters to display.

data.render:
NOTE: Introduced feature in v0.4.14.

IMPORTANT: This feature only runs on Javascript-enabled clients, you NEED to ALWAYS validate user input on the server.

NumberInput is a subset of NumberInput, which only accepts numbers and masks user input accordingly.

<script>
    import {NumberInput} from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    let value = 42;
</script>

<NumberInput bind:value />

Imports

<script>
    import {NumberInput} from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

Maximum + Minimum

NOTE: Introduced feature in v0.6.0.

You can have the NumberInput use disallow typing in numbers not within the range of the max and min properties.

<script>
    import {NumberInput} from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    let value = 42;
</script>

<NumberInput max={84} min={-84} bind:value />

</script>

    spacing="medium"
    variation="wrap"
>

    />
